author: trawick
msg: fix a typo which broke the check for whether share memory is file based

author: trawick
msg: change mkstemp() to apr_mkstemp() so we don't pollute somebody else's
apr_mkstemp() is only intended to be used within the Unix APR
implementation; a similar function but with an appropriate APR interface
would be nice to support cross-platform

author: trawick
msg: fix for ReliantUNIX and other platforms with no mkstemp() routine:
Don't rename mkstemp(); locks/unix/crossproc.c assumes that mkstemp() is the
Don't provide mkstemps(), mkdtemp(), or mktemp().

author: rbb
msg: Don't define the thread functions if threads haven't been included in the
build.  This allows Apache's threaded MPMs to die at compile time if
we build APR without threads.  This also makes more sense logically.
